alert.note: Alert for Addison (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 19 at 1:03AM EDT until July 20 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Vermont... Otter Creek At Middlebury affecting Addison County. For the Otter Creek...including Center Rutland, Middlebury...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Otter Creek at Middlebury. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:30 AM EDT Wednesday the stage was 7.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 6.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to continue to slowly fall, falling below flood stage Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 6.5 feet. - At 7 feet...Creek Road and 3 Mile Bridge Road will flood. Water begins to threaten lower portions of businesses on Bakery Lane and a few homes on Seymour Street near the covered bridge. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 115 PM EDT.
